text: Hiligaynon (also referred to as Ilonggo) is a spoken language in the Philippines with more than 9.1 million speakers. Hiligaynon is also part of the Visayan language family in the Central Philippines. Hiligaynon is most common in the Western Visayas (Region VI). The dialect of Mindanao Hiligaynon is common in Soccsksargen.https://dbpedia.org/page/Hiligaynon_language It is the third most common native language in the Philippines. Cebuano is second, and it is usually spoken in the Central and Eastern Visayas and the Southern Philippines.https://omniglot.com/writing/hiligaynon.htm ==Name== The name of Hiligaynon is comes from the Hiligaynon people from Iloilo province. They usually call it "Ilonggo" (Iloilo). The Hiligaynon people moved into Soccsksargen. The language was spread. ==Reference== Category:Austronesian languages Category:Languages of the Philippines
title: Hiligaynon language
